snippet: Western-backed insurgents are expressing frustration that the United States has not aided them as a mutual ally against both the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria and President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria is pressing deeper into Syria, regaining territory it had lost to mainstream Syrian insurgents, even as Syrian Army has come close to encircling insurgent-held section of Aleppo; dual advance is on verge of dealing potentially fatal blow to mainstream insurgents.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and Mohammad Ghannam contributed reporting from Beirut, and Ben Hubbard from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: Western-backed insurgents are expressing frustration that the United States has not aided them as a mutual ally against both the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria and President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.seo: Facing Both ISIS Militants and Bashar al-Assad’s Forces in Syria
headline.main: Dual Threat Has Mainstream Syrian Rebels Fearing Demise
headline.print_headline: Dual Threat Has Mainstream Syrian Rebels Fearing Demise

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
